body.name: C Shaped Slide Cover End Table with Charging Station, Narrow Sofa Side Table with USB Port and Wheels, Couch Table with Storage Bag for Living Room Bedroom
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 11 hrs 19 mins
features: 【Charging Station-USB Ports & AC Outlets】Colima C-Shape End Table features a built-in charging station with 2 USB ports and 2 AC outlets. Keep devices within reach, cords organized, and devices powered up and ready to use.

【Silent Lockable Wheels】 Designed with a narrow C-shape and 2 lockable wheels, this end table fits tight spots and can be easily moved around. The lock wheels are designed for stability – a solution for compact spaces.

【Versatile Usage】 Elevate your living space with a table that adapts to your needs. Place it over a couch for snacks, or use it as a laptop desk. It can slide under sofa couch or a bed. Its multi-use design enhances various scenarios.
【Expand Your Space】 The slide-out table panel provides instant surface expansion. Whether for work or leisure, enjoy the flexibility of more space when desired.
【Integrated Storage】 Designed with a side bag,Colima C shape end table organize magazines, remotes, or essentials neatly, enhancing both the table's functionality and your space's tidiness.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Terrible to put together. 2 people and 2 hours each - OMG. One is a carpender and hated it
reviews.reviewText: Wow was this thing terrible to setup. never ever again! I would have paid $50 for something else. Once setup is what I expected, small cheap but work next to my limited space for my computer

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Read the specs and watch the video reviews first
reviews.reviewText: This one's on me. I was expecting something that would allow me to use my laptop in bed. This is way too small for that.It is the height of the average bedside end table. The bed would have to be on the floor for to use a laptop on it while in bed.It is also slightly above Walmart quality materials and slightly below IKEA quality construction.It would work for someone who just needs a cool end table next to a couch or bed in their apartment, but it is not designed to last or for heavy use.It's only $50, so I wasn't expecting much. But, I did return it after contemplating whether I had any alternative uses for it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Small pockets, but otherwise awesome!
reviews.reviewText: At first, I was a little annoyed by the pocket pouch on this table. Everything else was incredibly perfect. But the pockets are too small to fit standard remotes. It ended up being an easy fix though. I had some stick on Velcro that I stuck down the center of the middle large pocket to create two deep, remote pockets. I then sewed the center remote pocket so that it didn’t hang outward when the remote was put in it. Now the remotes and my cords all fit within the pocket pouches easily and without excessive hanging.I absolutely love the table. And the ability to extend it is exactly what I needed! The design is completely unique to anything else I have seen, and it fits perfectly within my space. It allows me to extend it out over my loveseat, which I sit on sideways, and place an easel on it to draw or place a dinner plate there to eat.The instructions were easy to follow, and I got everything built without too much hassle. It came with everything that I needed, including a few extra screws just in case.Overall I greatly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice snack table
reviews.reviewText: Was fairly easy to assemble by myself. Don't tighten bolts until all assembled . Use a mallet or hammer to lightly tap the tubes into place . Use the screwdriver to line up holes before trying to put screws in. Read instructions and take your time and you will save assembly time. Just common sense. The small wrench is to tighten wheels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Things to know about this table;Pros:It's a table.Cons:- It is wobbly as all get out.-The plastic parts 9 and 9-1 are oversized. they will have to be pounded in with a mallet to fit and they are not straight when going in, which causes the first point.-You may have to drill a hole in part 7 mine was missing a hole which needed a drill to push through.-The screwdriver that came with this is either melted or was badly cast, it almost cut my hand open using it.-What is the flat wrench for? It's too big to tighten the only nuts found on this table-The aforementioned nuts will fall out so be careful, you'll have to tighten those with your own wrench, and without them the table top won't attach so be warned.Yeah, this table was not worth the money or the effort to put together. Everything about it is faulty in some fashion or another, no quality control at all. If I didn't need something right now, I'd return this hunk of junk to China and pay the shipping fee myself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Tip over easily
reviews.reviewText: Instructions were so-so to understand on assembly. once put together, one was wobbly (we bought 2). Both like to tip when any weight is on them and they are pulled out. Good concept but horrible in real life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and convenient
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I am 36/F and like to think that I am fairly capable and mostly handy, under average circumstances.I made the mistake of thinking that assembling this would "be totally quick and easy" and decided to put it together as I was supposed to be getting ready (and leaving) for work. All in all, it took me an hour and 14 minutes to assemble, with only a couple of hang-ups, but it definitely wasn't as quick as I thought it would be. I did struggle with putting the canvas bag on, so it is important to make sure you don't tighten all of the screws until the very end (common sense).Initially I was going to use this for a vanity cart - to hold my hot tools, blow dryer, clips, etc. The built in plug was much easier to access than the powerstrip I have under my vanity and it looked a lot neater. Ultimately, I decided to put it in the bedroom as my personal work station (I felt like I was wasting it uses bc I couldn't put anything in the storage pouch when I had it next to my vanity). It holds my tablet, mini-keyboard, pens, and a small notebook perfectly and it does not take up a lot of space.I wanted to spruce it up a little, so I added concrete temporary wallpaper (like thick contact paper) to the surfaces; I think it makes it look better than the all black surface.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars serves a purpose
reviews.reviewText: this works well. Putting it together is not super simple. the pull out table is difficult. I had to watch the third video that is connected to the product. the first video is terrible. The price is great. overall value
